aws-cli.dynamodb: get an item: aws dynamodb get-item --table-name=$(aws dynamodb list-tables | jq ".TableNames[]" | tr -d \" | fzf) --key='{ "path": { "S": "/hello" } }'
aws-cli.logs: get events by log group: aws logs tail $(aws logs describe-log-groups | jq ".logGroups[].logGroupName" | tr -d \" | fzf) --follow --format short

tmux.sessions: kill session by name: tmux kill-session -t $(tmux list-sessions | awk '{print $1}' | tr -d : | fzf)

bash.set bold text:
bold=$(tput bold)
normal=$(tput sgr0)
echo "${bold}bold text${normal} normal text"
bash.get exit code: $? # holds the exit code of the previous command (https://madflojo.medium.com/understanding-exit-codes-in-bash-6942a8b96ce5)
